summary: U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers and agents follow a detailed process for seizing illicit drugs, including collecting and recording data on drug type and how it was concealed. Although CBP data systems have various fields for recording such data, CBP hasn't assessed if the drug type categories in its systems adequately reflect drug smuggling scenarios that officers and agents confront. Also, officers and agents...
title: Border Security: CBP Could Improve How It Categorizes Drug Seizure Data and Evaluates Training
